data.features#Features: üß† Natural language to commands - Just describe what you want ‚ö° Lightning fast - Cached responses are 100-400x faster üîå Universal compatibility - Works with Ollama, OpenAI, Claude, and more üõ°Ô∏è Safe by default - Preview commands before execution üìö Learn while you work - Inline explanations for every command üéØ Zero dependencies - Single compiled binary
data.quick-links#Quick Links: Installation - Get vibe installed on your system Configuration - Configure your LLM provider Usage - Learn how to use vibe with examples Troubleshooting - Common issues and solutions Configuration Reference - Complete environment variable reference API Reference - Developer documentation
data.vibe-documentation#vibe Documentation: vibe DocumentationWelcome to the vibe documentation! This guide will help you get started with transforming natural language into shell commands using AI.
data.what-is-vibe#What is vibe?:
vibe is a zsh plugin that transforms natural language into shell commands using AI. Just type what you want to do in plain English, press Ctrl+G, and get the command with inline explanations.
# Type your intent in natural language list all docker containers # Press Ctrl+G # Get the command with explanations docker ps -a # docker: Docker command-line tool # ps: List containers # -a: Show all containers (not just running)

data: This document describes the internal API and architecture of vibe for developers who want to understand how it works or contribute to the project.
data.1-zsh-plugin-vibepluginzsh#1. Zsh Plugin:
The entry point for user interaction.
Functions:
vibe() Captures the current command buffer, sends it to the Go binary, and replaces the buffer with the generated command.
Key Variables:
VIBE_PLUGIN_DIR: Plugin installation directory VIBE_BINARY: Path to the Go binary BUFFER: Zsh variable containing current command line Keybinding:
bindkey '^G' vibe
data.2-go-binary-cmdvibego#2. Go Binary (\u00:
Main command-line interface.
Command Structure:
vibe [flags] Flags:
None currently. Configuration is done via environment variables.
Exit Codes:
0: Success 1: Error (details on stderr)
data.3-configuration-internalconfigconfiggo#3:
Manages all configuration from environment variables.
Type:
type Config struct { APIURL string APIKey string Model string Temperature float64 MaxTokens int Timeout time.Duration ShowExplanation bool ShowWarnings bool EnableCache bool CacheTTL time.Duration Interactive bool } Loading:
cfg := config.Load()
data.4-client-internalclientclientgo#4. Clien:
Handles communication with OpenAI-compatible APIs.
Interface:
type Client interface { Complete(ctx context.Context, prompt string) (*Response, error) } Request Structure:
type CompletionRequest struct { Model string `json:"model"` Messages []Message `json:"messages"` Temperature float64 `json:"temperature"` MaxTokens int `json:"max_tokens"` } Response Structure:
type Response struct { Command string Explanation []string Warning string }
Parses LLM responses into structured command + explanations.
Interface:
type Parser interface { Parse(response string) (*ParsedCommand, error) } Output:
type ParsedCommand struct { Command string Explanation []string IsValid bool } Format:
The parser expects responses in this format:
command # explanation line 1 # explanation line 2
data.6-cache-internalcachecachego#6. Cache (\:
File-based caching system for responses.
Interface:
type Cache interface { Get(key string) (string, bool) Set(key string, value string, ttl time.Duration) error Clear() error } Cache Location:
~/.cache/vibe/ Key Generation:
key := sha256(query + model + temperature)
data.7-schema-internalschemaschemago#7. Schem:
Defines the system prompt sent to the LLM.
System Prompt:
const SystemPrompt = `You are a shell command generator...` This prompt instructs the LLM to:
Generate only valid shell commands Provide explanations as comments Warn about dangerous operations Be concise and accurate
data.adding-a-new-provider#Adding a New Provi: Implement the Client interface Add provider-specific authentication Map provider response format to Response struct Add configuration options Update documentation
data.architecture-overview#Architecture Overv: ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ Zsh Plugin ‚îÇ ‚îÇ (vibe.plugin) ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚îÇ Captures buffer ‚îÇ on Ctrl+G ‚ñº ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ Go Binary ‚îÇ ‚îÇ (cmd/vibe.go) ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚ñº ‚ñº ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ Cache Layer ‚îÇ ‚îÇ LLM Client ‚îÇ ‚îÇ (internal/cache)‚îÇ ‚îÇ(internal/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ client) ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îÇ ‚îÇ OpenAI API ‚ñº ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ LLM Provider‚îÇ ‚îÇ (Ollama/GPT) ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
data.building#Building: make build # Current platform make build-all # All platforms
data.code-style#Code Style: Follow standard Go conventions Use gofmt for formatting Add tests for new functionality Update documentation
data.contributing#Contributing: See the main README for contribution guidelines.
data.dependencies#Dependencies:
vibe uses only the Go standard library:
net/http: HTTP client encoding/json: JSON parsing crypto/sha256: Cache key generation os, io, time, context: Standard utilities No external dependencies = simple, secure, maintainable code.
data.error-handling#Error Handling:
All errors are returned on stderr with descriptive messages:
if err != nil { fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "vibe: %v\n", err) os.Exit(1) }
data.extending-functionality#Extending Functi:
Adding a new configuration option:
Add to Config struct in internal/config/config.go Add environment variable parsing Update documentation Add tests Modifying the system prompt:
Edit internal/schema/schema.go Test with multiple LLM providers Ensure backward compatibility
data.integration-tests#Integration Tests:
Test with live API:
export VIBE_API_URL="http://localhost:11434/v1" export VIBE_MODEL="llama3:8b" ./vibe "list all files"
data.pull-request-process#Pull Request Proces: Fork the repository Create a feature branch Make your changes Add tests Update documentation Submit PR
data.request-flow#Request Flow:
User Input
User types natural language Presses Ctrl+G Zsh Plugin
Captures $BUFFER Calls Go binary: vibe "$BUFFER" Configuration
Loads environment variables Validates settings Cache Check
Generates cache key from query + config Returns cached response if available LLM Request
Constructs completion request Sends to configured API Applies retry logic with backoff Response Parsing
Extracts command and explanations Validates format Output
Writes to stdout Go binary exits Zsh Plugin
Reads stdout Replaces $BUFFER with command Shows explanations as comments
data.unit-tests#Unit Tests:
Run all tests:
make test Test specific package:
go test ./internal/parser

data: All configuration is done through environment variables in your ~/.zshrc. All settings are optional and have sensible defaults.
data.api-settings#API Settings:
Set request timeout (default: 30s):
export VIBE_TIMEOUT=60s Set generation temperature (default: 0.7):
export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.3 Lower temperature = more deterministic, higher = more creative.
Set maximum response tokens (default: 500):
export VIBE_MAX_TOKENS=1000
data.configuration-reference#Configuration Re: Variable Default Description VIBE_API_URL http://localhost:11434/v1 API endpoint URL VIBE_API_KEY "" API key (if required) VIBE_MODEL llama3:8b Model to use VIBE_TEMPERATURE 0.7 Generation temperature VIBE_MAX_TOKENS 500 Max response tokens VIBE_TIMEOUT 30s Request timeout VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION true Show command explanations VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS true Show warnings for dangerous commands VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE true Enable response caching VIBE_CACHE_TTL 24h Cache lifetime VIBE_INTERACTIVE false Confirm before inserting
data.example-configuration#Example Configurat:
Here‚Äôs a complete example configuration in your ~/.zshrc:
# vibe configuration export VIBE_API_URL="https://api.openai.com/v1" export VIBE_API_KEY="sk-..." export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-4" export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.5 export VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION=true export VIBE_INTERACTIVE=false export VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE=true export VIBE_CACHE_TTL=24h
data.interactive-mode#Interactive Mode:
Require confirmation before inserting commands (default: false):
export VIBE_INTERACTIVE=true When enabled, vibe will show the command and ask for confirmation before inserting it into your prompt.
data.local-llm-ollama---default#Local LLM (Ol: export VIBE_API_URL="http://localhost:11434/v1" export VIBE_MODEL="llama3:8b" This is the default configuration. If you have Ollama running locally, vibe will work out of the box.
data.openai#OpenAI: export VIBE_API_URL="https://api.openai.com/v1" export VIBE_API_KEY="sk-..." export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-4"
data.showhide-explanations#Show/Hide Explanat:
Control whether command explanations are displayed (default: true):
export VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION=false
data.showhide-warnings#Show/Hide Warnings:
Control whether warnings are shown for dangerous commands (default: true):
export VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS=false

data.3-add-to-your-zshrc#3. Add to your \u003:
Edit your ~/.zshrc and add vibe to the plugins array:
plugins=(... vibe)
data.building-from-source#Building from Sourc:
If you want to build from source:
git clone https://github.com/skymoore/vibe-zsh.git cd vibe-zsh make build # Build for current platform make build-all # Build for all platforms make test # Run tests make install # Install to oh-my-zsh
data.manual-install#Manual Install: If you prefer to install manually:
data.next-steps#Next Steps: After installation, you‚Äôll want to configure your API settings.
data.one-line-install#One-Line Install:
The easiest way to install vibe is using our automated installation script:
curlwget curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/skymoore/vibe-zsh/main/install.sh | bash wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/skymoore/vibe-zsh/main/install.sh | bash This script will:
Clone the repository to ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe Build the binary for your platform Add the plugin to your .zshrc Reload your shell
data.verification#Verification:
After installation, verify that vibe is working:
# Check that the binary exists which vibe # Type something and press Ctrl+G echo "test" # Then press Ctrl+G

data: Complete reference for all vibe configuration options.
data.anthropic-via-openrouter#Anthropic (via: export VIBE_API_URL="https://openrouter.ai/api/v1" export VIBE_API_KEY="sk-or-..." export VIBE_MODEL="anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet" export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.7 export VIBE_MAX_TOKENS=500
data.applying-configuration-changes#Applying:
After modifying environment variables in ~/.zshrc:
source ~/.zshrc Or restart your terminal.
data.common-issues#Common Issues:
‚ÄúConnection refused‚Äù
Check VIBE_API_URL is correct Verify service is running (e.g., ollama serve) ‚ÄúUnauthorized‚Äù or ‚ÄúInvalid API key‚Äù
Verify VIBE_API_KEY is set and correct Check for extra quotes or spaces ‚ÄúModel not found‚Äù
Verify VIBE_MODEL exists for your provider For Ollama: ollama list Slow responses
Enable cache: VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE=true Reduce VIBE_MAX_TOKENS Use faster model or local LLM
data.complete-configuration-example#Complete: # API Configuration export VIBE_API_URL="https://api.openai.com/v1" export VIBE_API_KEY="sk-..." export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-4" export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.5 export VIBE_MAX_TOKENS=500 export VIBE_TIMEOUT=30s # Display Configuration export VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION=true export VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS=true # Behavior Configuration export VIBE_INTERACTIVE=false # Cache Configuration export VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE=true export VIBE_CACHE_TTL=24h
data.configuration-files#Configuration Files:
vibe uses environment variables only - no configuration files are required or used.
Cache location:
~/.cache/vibe/ Plugin location:
~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe/ To reset cache:
rm -rf ~/.cache/vibe/*
data.environment-variables#Environment Variab: All configuration is done through environment variables in your ~/.zshrc.
data.groq#Groq: export VIBE_API_URL="https://api.groq.com/openai/v1" export VIBE_API_KEY="gsk_..." export VIBE_MODEL="llama-3.1-70b-versatile" export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.4
data.local-llm-ollama#Local LLM (Ollama): # Minimal configuration (uses defaults) export VIBE_API_URL="http://localhost:11434/v1" export VIBE_MODEL="llama3:8b"
data.openai#OpenAI: export VIBE_API_URL="https://api.openai.com/v1" export VIBE_API_KEY="sk-..." export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-4" export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.5 export VIBE_TIMEOUT=30s
data.quick-reference-table#Quick Reference Ta: Variable Type Default Description VIBE_API_URL String http://localhost:11434/v1 API endpoint URL VIBE_API_KEY String "" API authentication key VIBE_MODEL String llama3:8b Model identifier VIBE_TEMPERATURE Float 0.7 Randomness (0.0-2.0) VIBE_MAX_TOKENS Integer 500 Max response tokens VIBE_TIMEOUT Duration 30s Request timeout VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION Boolean true Show explanations VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS Boolean true Show warnings VIBE_INTERACTIVE Boolean false Confirm before insert VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE Boolean true Enable caching VIBE_CACHE_TTL Duration 24h Cache lifetime VIBE_BINARY String Auto Binary path
data.test-configuration#Test Configuration:
Test with a simple query:
~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe/vibe "list files"
data.vibe_api_key#VIBE_API_KEY:
Type: String
Default: "" (empty, not required for Ollama)
Description: API key for authentication. Required for most cloud providers.
Examples:
# OpenAI export VIBE_API_KEY="sk-..." # OpenRouter export VIBE_API_KEY="sk-or-..." # Groq export VIBE_API_KEY="gsk_..." Security Note: Never commit API keys to version control.
data.vibe_api_url#VIBE_API_URL:
Type: String
Default: http://localhost:11434/v1
Description: The base URL for the OpenAI-compatible API endpoint.
Examples:
# Ollama (local) export VIBE_API_URL="http://localhost:11434/v1" # OpenAI export VIBE_API_URL="https://api.openai.com/v1" # Anthropic via OpenRouter export VIBE_API_URL="https://openrouter.ai/api/v1" # LM Studio export VIBE_API_URL="http://localhost:1234/v1" # Groq export VIBE_API_URL="https://api.groq.com/openai/v1"
data.vibe_binary#VIBE_BINARY:
Type: String
Default: ${VIBE_PLUGIN_DIR}/vibe
Description: Path to the vibe binary. Override if you want to use a custom binary location.
Example:
export VIBE_BINARY="/usr/local/bin/vibe"
data.vibe_cache_ttl#VIBE_CACHE_TTL:
Type: Duration
Default: 24h
Description: How long cached responses remain valid.
Examples:
# 1 hour export VIBE_CACHE_TTL=1h # 12 hours export VIBE_CACHE_TTL=12h # 24 hours (default) export VIBE_CACHE_TTL=24h # 7 days export VIBE_CACHE_TTL=168h Format: Number + unit (h for hours, m for minutes)
Cache location: ~/.cache/vibe/
data.vibe_enable_cache#VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE:
Type: Boolean
Default: true
Description: Enable response caching for faster repeated queries.
Examples:
# Enable cache (default) export VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE=true # Disable cache export VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE=false Impact:
Enabled: Cached queries return in ~5-10ms (100-400x faster) Disabled: Every query hits the API
data.vibe_interactive#VIBE_INTERACTIVE:
Type: Boolean
Default: false
Description: Require confirmation before inserting commands into the prompt.
Examples:
# Auto-insert (default) export VIBE_INTERACTIVE=false # Require confirmation export VIBE_INTERACTIVE=true When enabled:
--- docker ps -a --- Execute this command? [Y/n]
data.vibe_max_tokens#VIBE_MAX_TOKENS:
Type: Integer
Default: 500
Description: Maximum number of tokens in the API response.
Examples:
# Shorter responses (faster) export VIBE_MAX_TOKENS=300 # Default export VIBE_MAX_TOKENS=500 # Longer responses (for complex commands) export VIBE_MAX_TOKENS=1000 Note: Higher values increase API costs and response time.
data.vibe_model#VIBE_MODEL:
Type: String
Default: llama3:8b
Description: The model identifier to use for command generation.
Examples:
# Ollama export VIBE_MODEL="llama3:8b" export VIBE_MODEL="llama3.1:70b" export VIBE_MODEL="codellama:13b" # OpenAI export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-4" export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-4-turbo" export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-3.5-turbo" # Anthropic (via OpenRouter) export VIBE_MODEL="anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet" export VIBE_MODEL="anthropic/claude-3-opus" # Groq export VIBE_MODEL="llama-3.1-70b-versatile" export VIBE_MODEL="mixtral-8x7b-32768"
data.vibe_plugin_dir#VIBE_PLUGIN_DIR:
Type: String (read-only)
Default: Auto-detected
Description: Directory where the vibe plugin is installed. Automatically set by the plugin.
# Typically: ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe
data.vibe_show_explanation#VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANAT:
Type: Boolean
Default: true
Description: Show inline explanations for generated commands.
Examples:
# Show explanations (default) export VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION=true # Hide explanations export VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION=false When enabled:
docker ps -a # docker: Docker command-line tool # ps: List containers # -a: Show all containers (not just running) When disabled:
docker ps -a
data.vibe_show_warnings#VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS:
Type: Boolean
Default: true
Description: Display warnings for potentially dangerous commands.
Examples:
# Show warnings (default) export VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS=true # Hide warnings export VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS=false When enabled:
‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: This command may delete files rm -rf *
data.vibe_temperature#VIBE_TEMPERATURE:
Type: Float
Default: 0.7
Range: 0.0 to 2.0
Description: Controls randomness in the model‚Äôs output. Lower values make output more deterministic, higher values more creative.
Examples:
# More deterministic (recommended for commands) export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.3 # Balanced (default) export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.7 # More creative export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=1.0 Recommendations:
0.0-0.3: Most consistent, predictable commands 0.4-0.7: Balanced creativity and consistency 0.8-2.0: More variation (may produce unexpected results)
data.vibe_timeout#VIBE_TIMEOUT:
Type: Duration
Default: 30s
Description: Maximum time to wait for API response.
Examples:
# Shorter timeout export VIBE_TIMEOUT=15s # Default export VIBE_TIMEOUT=30s # Longer timeout (slow connections) export VIBE_TIMEOUT=60s Format: Number + unit (s for seconds, m for minutes)
data.view-current-configuration#View Current:
Check what vibe sees:
env | grep VIBE_

data.api-connection-errors#API Connection Err:
Symptoms: Errors like ‚Äúconnection refused‚Äù or ‚Äútimeout.‚Äù
Solutions:
For Ollama - check if it‚Äôs running:
curl http://localhost:11434/v1/models Start Ollama if needed:
ollama serve Verify API URL is correct:
echo $VIBE_API_URL Check API key is set (if using OpenAI/Claude):
echo $VIBE_API_KEY # Should not be empty Test API directly:
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $VIBE_API_KEY" $VIBE_API_URL/models
data.bad-command-suggestions#Bad Command Sugg:
Symptoms: Generated commands don‚Äôt match your intent or are incorrect.
Solutions:
Try a different/better model:
export VIBE_MODEL="gpt-4" # Or other capable models Make your query more specific:
‚ùå ‚Äúlist files‚Äù ‚úÖ ‚Äúlist all files in current directory including hidden ones with sizes‚Äù Check model supports structured output: Some models may not follow the expected output format.
Lower temperature for more deterministic results:
export VIBE_TEMPERATURE=0.3 Clear cache if getting stale results:
rm -rf ~/.cache/vibe/*
data.cache-issues#Cache Issues:
Symptoms: Getting outdated commands or cache-related errors.
Solutions:
Clear the cache:
rm -rf ~/.cache/vibe/* Disable cache temporarily:
export VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE=false Reduce cache TTL:
export VIBE_CACHE_TTL=1h
data.command-not-working-after-install#Comman:
Symptoms: Pressing Ctrl+G does nothing, or you get ‚Äúcommand not found‚Äù errors.
Solutions:
Reload your shell:
source ~/.zshrc Verify plugin is loaded:
echo $plugins # Should include "vibe" Check binary exists:
ls ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe/vibe # Should show the binary Verify function is loaded:
which vibe # Should show "vibe" as a shell function Rebuild the binary:
cd ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe make clean build
data.ctrlg-does-nothing#Ctrl+G Does Nothing:
Symptoms: Pressing Ctrl+G has no effect.
Solutions:
Check if another plugin uses Ctrl+G:
bindkey | grep '"\^G"' Rebind to different key:
bindkey '^X' vibe # Use Ctrl+X instead Ensure plugin is loaded:
echo $plugins | grep vibe Reload shell:
source ~/.zshrc
data.model-not-found#Model Not Found:
Symptoms: Error messages about model not being available.
Solutions:
For Ollama - pull the model:
ollama pull llama3:8b List available models:
# Ollama ollama list # OpenAI curl https://api.openai.com/v1/models \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $VIBE_API_KEY" Use a different model:
export VIBE_MODEL="llama3:8b"
data.permission-denied#Permission Denied:
Symptoms: ‚ÄúPermission denied‚Äù when trying to execute vibe binary.
Solutions:
Make binary executable:
chmod +x ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe/vibe Rebuild binary:
cd ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/vibe make clean build
data.slow-responses#Slow Responses:
Symptoms: vibe takes several seconds to respond.
Solutions:
Enable caching:
export VIBE_ENABLE_CACHE=true Cached responses are 100-400x faster!
Use a faster model:
export VIBE_MODEL="llama3:8b" # Instead of larger models Use a local LLM:
export VIBE_API_URL="http://localhost:11434/v1" export VIBE_MODEL="llama3:8b" Check network connection:
curl -I $VIBE_API_URL Increase timeout if needed:
export VIBE_TIMEOUT=60s
data.still-having-issues#Still Having Issues?:
If you‚Äôre still experiencing problems:
Check the logs:
# vibe logs errors to stderr vibe "test query" 2>&1 Enable debug mode (if available):
export VIBE_DEBUG=true Report the issue:
Visit: https://github.com/skymoore/vibe-zsh/issues Include: Your OS and version Zsh version: zsh --version Oh-My-Zsh version vibe configuration (environment variables) Error messages or unexpected behavior Join the community:
Check existing issues for solutions Ask questions in discussions Contribute fixes if you find them!

data.basic-usage#Basic Usage:
Using vibe is simple:
Type a natural language description in your terminal Press Ctrl+G Review the generated command (with explanations) Press Enter to execute, or edit first
data.be-specific#Be Specific:
More specific queries generate better commands:
‚ùå Vague: ‚Äúlist files‚Äù ‚úÖ Specific: ‚Äúlist all files including hidden ones with human-readable sizes‚Äù
data.combine-with-other-tools#Combine with Ot:
Vibe-generated commands work with pipes and other shell features:
# Generate: docker ps # Edit to: docker ps | grep nginx
data.command-explanations#Command Explanation:
By default, vibe shows explanations for each part of the command:
docker ps -a # docker: Docker command-line tool # ps: List containers # -a: Show all containers (not just running) To hide explanations:
export VIBE_SHOW_EXPLANATION=false
data.docker#Docker: show logs of nginx container and follow them # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí docker logs -f nginx list all docker containers including stopped ones # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí docker ps -a remove all stopped containers # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí docker container prune
data.edit-generated-commands#Edit Generated C:
The generated command is editable. Use arrow keys to modify it before executing:
# Generated: git log --since="1 week ago" # Edit to: git log --since="2 weeks ago" --author="yourname"
data.file-operations#File Operations: show me all hidden files including their sizes # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí ls -lah find all python files modified today # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí find . -name "*.py" -mtime 0 compress all log files into an archive # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí tar -czf logs.tar.gz *.log
data.git#Git: show me commits from last week # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí git log --since="1 week ago" undo the last commit but keep the changes # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí git reset --soft HEAD~1 show me what changed in the last commit # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí git show HEAD
data.interactive-mode#Interactive Mode:
When VIBE_INTERACTIVE=true, vibe will ask for confirmation before inserting commands:
export VIBE_INTERACTIVE=true # Type: delete all log files # Press Ctrl+G --- rm *.log --- Execute this command? [Y/n]
data.keybindings#Keybindings:
Key Action Ctrl+G Generate command from natural language To change the keybinding, add this to your .zshrc:
bindkey '^X' vibe # Use Ctrl+X instead
data.network#Network: test if port 443 is open on example.com # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí nc -zv example.com 443 show my public ip address # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí curl ifconfig.me download a file and show progress # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí curl -# -O
data.review-before-executing#Review Before Ex: Always review the generated command before pressing Enter. Vibe is a tool to help you, not to blindly execute commands.
data.safety-warnings#Safety Warnings:
Vibe will warn you about potentially dangerous commands:
# Type: delete everything in current directory # Press Ctrl+G ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: This command may delete files rm -rf * To disable warnings:
export VIBE_SHOW_WARNINGS=false
data.system-administration#System Administrat: show disk usage of all mounted filesystems # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí df -h find processes listening on port 8080 # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí lsof -i :8080 show memory usage sorted by process # Press Ctrl+G # ‚Üí ps aux --sort=-%mem | head
data.tab-completion#Tab Completion:
Vibe provides tab completion for common queries:
vibe # Shows common query suggestions
data.use-natural-language#Use Natural Languag:
Write how you would explain the task to someone:
‚úÖ ‚Äúshow me all processes using more than 100MB of memory‚Äù ‚úÖ ‚Äúfind all files larger than 1GB modified in the last hour‚Äù
